summary: The fact that Michael Sheen and Keanu Reeves have collectively become the internet’s new boyfriends not only warms my heart but...
body: The fact that Michael Sheen and Keanu Reeves have collectively become the internet’s new boyfriends not only warms my heart but gives me hope we might have decent taste on the whole at least for this moment.

blog.name: iwoulddieforkeanureeves
blog.title: ❤️ Keanu ❤️
blog.description:
☁️Lee | 18 | Aspiring Artist and Writer | Lover of Keanu Reeves(HMU w requests) ☁️

(New to Tumblr!)

summary:
Previous Part: https://iwoulddieforkeanureeves.tumblr.com/post/185667051574/part-1
John slowly opened the door, all of the joy...
body:
Fortune Favors The Kind Part 3 (John Wick x Reader)

Fortune Favors The Kind Part 2 (John Wick x Reader)

Previous Part: https://iwoulddieforkeanureeves.tumblr.com/post/185667051574/part-1

John slowly opened the door, all of the joy on his face just moments earlier faded away into an impassive emotionless face. Santino D'Antonio. John knew what he was here for before Santino could even say hello, or rather,

“Ciao, John.” Santino spoke, a small smirk teasing at the corner of his lips. He felt rather confident, despite staring at the Baba Yaga himself. He knew he had the upper hand at the moment, and relished in that as he shook John’s hand.

“Santino.” John replied cooly, glancing behind Santino at the cars and guards. He made eye contact with what appeared to be his right hand woman, her eyes locked firmly on him.

“May I come in?” He asked, tucking his hands into his pockets and rocking on his feet slightly.

John stepped back slightly, “Of course.” He replied in Italian, John quickly looked back to where you were still sitting, body practically frozen. He knew that Santino was a dangerous man, and it would be preferable that he didn’t know you existed. But he had his home surrounded, so it wasn’t like you could leave. “Café?” John continued, walking down the hall.  He sent Santino into the living room, and gestured for you to follow him as we went to the coffee machine.

John was staring straight ahead as he slowly poured a single cup of espresso, he turned to you. He sighed softly, then turned and began walking towards the living room, making sure you were right behind him. He set the cup in front of Santino, and sat down.

As you walked in you saw Santino scratching your pitbull, and you felt anger like a pit in your stomach growing. You didn’t like this guy’s attitude, his smug smile, his Italian suit, and you definitely didn’t like his hands on your dog. He looked up at you as you entered, a flash of surprise crossed his face as his eyes looked you over. “I was sorry to hear about your wife John, but I didn’t realize you had a puppy… and a child.” Santino spoke, you felt uncomfortable under his gaze, but maintained eye contact.

You and Santino turned as John spoke, his voice was quiet yet firm, “(Y/N), can you take the dog out, please?” He asked you, you looked at him with a bit of surprise before cooing to the pup and leading him out of the living room.

~

As you exited, Santino leaned back in his chair, his body relaxed, yet his face still carried that devilish smile. “Listen John, in all sincerity,” he leaned forward, staring right at John. “I don’t want to be here.”

John shifted slightly, never breaking eye contact. “Please. Don’t.” He spoke, his tone still firm and unwavering. “I’m asking you not to do this.”

Santino gently shook his head, chuckling softly as he reached into his pocket, “Nobody gets out of the business and gets to waltz back in without repercussions, John.” He pulled out the marker, the rich gold of the marker contrasting with the dark coffee table as he slid it across the table towards John. “If not for what I did, you wouldn’t have any of this.” He swirled his finger around the room, “That beautiful girl of yours, this house, all of it, is in part, mine.” He tilted his head slightly, but John was not moved.

“Take it back.” His gaze was stone cold, hands clasped together.

The smirk had finally faltered from the Italian’s face. “No.”

“Take it back.” John repeated, his face was impassive, but his thoughts were swirling. He couldn’t go back in now, not now that you were in the picture. He had gotten you out too, and he knew this world would tear you to pieces if you were forced to go back. “Find someone else.”

Santino threw his hands up in disbelief, before grabbing the marker and flipping it open, revealing John’s fingerprint. “This is your blood John, you know what this means.” He continued. He couldn’t believe John was doing this, Santino’s blood boiled at the fact John was refusing him, despite the marker. Despite the rules. He practically flung the marker back to John’s side of the table.

John looked down at the marker, “I’m not that guy anymore.” He said, pushing down memories of his task, and thinking about Helen, and Daisy, and you. He slowly slid the marker back over to Santino before standing up, and staring down at him. “I think it’s time for you to leave.”

~

Your fingers were wrapped so tightly around the leash your knuckles were turning white, you had no clue what was going on between John and Santino. You didn’t know how big of a threat he was, or why he was here, all you knew your gut was screaming at you that something was wrong. The pup could sense your unease, and was whining at your feet, nudging you gently with his wet nose. You reached down to gently stroke his head, he clearly wasn’t in a walking mood, so you began to go back towards the house. The closer you were to John the safer you felt. You wanted to make sure you were there in case anything happened.

You hastily opened the back door, Santino was gone, and John was standing in the room, gently holding a photo of Helen and himself and stroking the frame. You quickly unhooked the leash from the dog’s collar, letting him roam free as you slowly came up behind John. Before you could ask about what has transpired when you were gone, the two of you heard the sound of glass shattering in the room over. You turned to eachother, eyes wide. It felt like slow motion as the place you had come to think of as home was being overwhelmed by flame and heat. You were flung backwards by the force of it, the wind had been knocked out of you as you laid in the soft grass, gasping for breath as you stared at the burning visage of your home.

Bang. Bang. Bang. Explosion after explosion continued to assault the foundation of everything you had cared about. Your home. You slowly got up onto your knees, your body shaking with a mixture of anger and fear. The angry red hot flame continued to engulf everything around it, and you felt hot tears well up in your eyes.

You tore your eyes away from the embers, you began to quietly sob as you shuffled on your hands and knees where you saw the outline of John’s figure. He was on his knees, his eyes locked into his home, and hands balled tightly into fists. You went to him, and collapsed onto his body, unable to control your tears as they flowed freely down your cheeks. You were in a state of shock, all you could think about was crawling towards the only thing you had left. Your fingers gripped his shirt, desperately clinging to it.

John didn’t look down at you, but slowly wrapped his arms around your shaking shoulders. He felt a slobbery wet tongue lick at him, but his gaze remained fixed on his smoldering home. Again, flashes of memories whirled around in his mind, their edges crisping up and falling away. No matter how hard he clutched onto the things he loved, they always managed to fall through his fingers. John slowly began to stand up, pulling your weight as well as his own.

The deep orange of the fire was reflected in John’s dark eyes. A flame had been lit, and anger and a desire for vengeance was seeping into every fiber of his being. This was an act that would not go unpunished.

blog.name: bardolatress
blog.title: There was a star danced, and under that was I born

tags: HOW do people convince themselves that Shakespeare wasn't Shakespeare?
Also WHY do people get behind the Oxfordian theory?
Aside from the fact he died in 160-bloody-4
He wrote his own shit under his own name to no great acclaim
Keanu always lets me down when Shakespeare is involved
title: Keanu Reeves is anti-Stratfordian
body: He is officially out, non compos mentis, verboten, this is officially a Keanu-free blog from henceforth.

reblog.comment: He is officially out, non compos mentis, verboten, this is officially a Keanu-free blog from henceforth.

blog.name: moonlightchess
blog.title: the moonlight chess society;
blog.description:
welcome. we've been waiting for you. games start at midnight and may never end, we'll send you the address when it's time. something in the trees rustles restlessly whenever rooks attack, pay it no mind. refreshments will be provided, but alchemical potions to aid in one's focus must be brought from home. ignore the indignant whispering from your bishops - queenside castling makes them nervous, but it's your game. the moon determines stalemates, if she won't let you concede then you'll just have to play on. you'll be hearing from us soon.

teddy ♛ autumn ♛ chess ♛ academia ♛ aesthetic ♛ the weird & wonderful ♛ paranormal ♛ writing ♛ etc

my writing | my edits

tags: i can't be the only person who's thought about this
summary:
okay but John Wick/Frank Castle though? 

•  Both love dogs. Every time they’re driving past a shelter and the one behind the...
body:
okay but John Wick/Frank Castle though?

•  Both love dogs. Every time they’re driving past a shelter and the one behind the wheel slows down hopefully, it’s the responsibility of the other to sternly remind him, “no.”

•  Both are almost definitely secret fans of classical music. John, raised in the world of ballet, is quite a talented pianist (The Director taught him until he was good enough to play for her girls’ rehearsals.) Frank likes to listen to him play at night, while he’s cleaning his guns.

•  Never once have they asked each other for help on a kill. They don’t need to - they both seem to just know instinctively when the other is in trouble, and John will somehow just show up if Frank ever needs him, and vice versa.

•  Frank likes to cook, and John is fussy about keeping the house neat. Frank will occasionally annoy him deliberately by leaving dishes in the sink, just because he thinks it’s cute what a “prissy, tidy little shit” John is.

•  They don’t talk about Helen, ever. Or Maria.

•  Their sex life is surprisingly gentle, despite what the very few who know about their relationship might assume. They’ve both seen enough violence and rage and pain permeating literally every other aspect of their lives, in bed together they’re tender and considerate with each other. They’re both long since over being embarrassed about their natural instinct for cuddling.

•  They don’t go out much. Both to keep a low profile, and because they’re both homebodies by nature. They like to stay in, make dinner for each other, watch old cowboy movies and do puzzles or play chess. John is the better player, but Frank is learning quickly. Sometimes when he pulls off a particularly clever move, John will smile faintly at him across the board and say softly, “nice,” and Frank’s heart stutters.

•  Frank once watched John drive a screwdriver through the eyeball and deep into the brain of an Irish mafia enforcer in one brutal attack, and as the man collapsed shrieking and spurting blood before dying at their feet, John met Frank’s eyes and said coolly, “you didn’t thaw the chicken before we left the house, did you.” There’s a part of his lover that is capable of shutting off his emotions entirely to perform necessary tasks, and Frank isn’t sure if he’s more impressed or unnerved by this.

•  They’re both early risers, and will often wake up with the sun to go jogging or swimming together. Frank, the younger of the two, is frequently stunned by John’s strength and physical prowess in middle age, not to mention how damn graceful he can be. He’ll tease him and mutter “fuckin’ ballerinas, man,” but watching him in the gym makes his mouth water sometimes.

•  Neither of them had ever been with a man before meeting each other. Frank fooled around with other boys some as a teenager and young man, experimenting, but they were each other’s first gay sexual experience. Their first time was clumsy and sweaty and messy, but at one point John started to laugh, laughing like he hadn’t since Helen’s death, laughing like Frank had never seen him, and the realization that he was in love with this man crushed him like falling anvil in a cartoon.

•  Karen has met John, and she likes him a lot. “There’s something old-fashioned about him,” she said to Frank once. “I bet he holds open doors for old ladies and shit. You know, in between all the violent murders.”

•  Neither of them sleeps well. Frank has a habit of doing a few shots before bed to help put him out, but John doesn’t really drink much. He likes a nice bourbon if he’s going to, but since they moved in together they’ve taken to sitting up in bed talking until they both pass out. John mumbles in his sleep in a language Frank doesn’t understand, and sometimes he even sleepwalks. Frank has learned that all it takes to get him back into bed is gently pointing him in the right direction and saying “come on, guy,” into his ear and he’ll slowly shuffle back to bed, still fast asleep.

reblog.comment:

•  Both are almost definitely secret fans of classical music. John, raised in the world of ballet, is quite a talented pianist (The Director taught him until he was good enough to play for her girls’ rehearsals.) Frank likes to listen to him play at night, while he’s cleaning his guns.

•  Frank likes to cook, and John is fussy about keeping the house neat. Frank will occasionally annoy him deliberately by leaving dishes in the sink, just because he thinks it’s cute what a “prissy, tidy little shit” John is.

•  They don’t talk about Helen, ever. Or Maria.

•  Their sex life is surprisingly gentle, despite what the very few who know about their relationship might assume. They’ve both seen enough violence and rage and pain permeating literally every other aspect of their lives, in bed together they’re tender and considerate with each other. Frank has learned that all it takes to get him back into bed is gently pointing him in the right direction and saying “come on, guy,” into his ear and he’ll slowly shuffle back to bed, still fast asleep.

•  Both are almost definitely secret fans of classical music. John, raised in the world of ballet, is quite a talented pianist (The Director taught him until he was good enough to play for her girls’ rehearsals.) Frank likes to listen to him play at night, while he’s cleaning his guns.

He likes a nice bourbon if he’s going to, but since they moved in together they’ve taken to sitting up in bed talking until they both pass out. Frank has learned that all it takes to get him back into bed is gently pointing him in the right direction and saying “come on, guy,” into his ear and he’ll slowly shuffle back to bed, still fast asleep.

title: I just realized
body:
Keanu Reeves’s ‘Cyberpunk 2077′ character, Johnny Silverhand is a glitch/ghost thing that resides inside the main character’s body/mind/circuit guiding him, giving him advice, and other nefarious things. 

Celebrimbor in Shadow of Mordor-War is a ghost residing in the main character, Talion’s body, guiding him, giving him advice and generally being nefarious. 

‘Celebrimbor’ is Sindarin for Silver Hand. So Keanu Reeves is Celebrimbor.

reblog.comment:
